page.title: 04Shopping
page.content: Both Bricket Wood and How Wood have only small parades of shops, where you can buy the basic necessities.But in a village, it means that the shopkeepers get to know you, and they are really friendly.In Bricket Wood, the parade of shops in Oakwood Road has an Off Licence,a small supermarket, a newsagents (also selling sweets and tobacco and stationery),a chemists,a greengrocer,and a butcher's.Mr.Brooks owns the butcher's and he runs it with his son and two other men.You always get a laugh there. Watford is a good shopping centre, as there are lots of big stores.Lots of mums go to one of the big supermarkets like Sainsbury's, Tesco, or Waitrose in the nearby towns.
